Metadata.title: Piroola: Professional AI Audio Mixing & Mastering Online
Metadata.description: Transform your tracks with Piroola. Our AI-powered mixing and mastering service delivers professional studio-quality results from your multi-track stems in minutes.

HeroSection.description: Transform your home recordings (stems) into professional, Spotify-ready mixes in minutes. Piroola handles the technical engineering so you can focus on the music.

FeaturesSection.title: From your <daw>DAW</daw> to the World.
FeaturesSection.subtitle: We have simplified complex engineering into a seamless experience. No infinite menus, just superior sonic results.

0.title: Seamless Integration
0.description: Forget about exporting and importing. Piroola lives inside your favorite DAW (Ableton, Logic, Pro Tools) as a native VST3/AU plugin.

1.title: Sonic Intelligence
1.description: Our AI scans your tracks to understand key, tempo, genre, and instrumentation, creating a custom mixing strategy.

2.title: Mastering Grade Polish
2.description: Finalizes your track with industry-standard loudness matching, stereo widening, and limiter safety.

3.title: Ready for the World
3.description: Export your masters in high-resolution WAV and MP3 formats ready for distribution on Spotify, Apple Music, and more.

BenefitsSection.headerDesc: The intelligent mastering suite that transforms home demos into commercial hits in seconds.
BenefitsSection.speedDescription: Forget manual gain staging and resonance cleanup. Piroola automates the heavy technical lifting so you can create.
BenefitsSection.qualityDescription: Algorithms trained on Billboard hits for competitive results.

LiveSoundAnalysis.label: Live Analytics Engine
LiveSoundAnalysis.title: Visualize the Invisible.
LiveSoundAnalysis.description: Stop guessing. Piroola provides surgical precision metrics to ensure your mix meets streaming standards (Spotify, Apple Music) and broadcast.

metrics.description: Excellent mono compatibility. No critical phase cancellations.

PipelineInteractiveDiagram.label: Audio Engineering Workflow
PipelineInteractiveDiagram.title: Mixing & Mastering Pipeline
PipelineInteractiveDiagram.description: Interactively explore each stage of the audio production process, from initial analysis to final polishing.

0.title: Analysis
0.shortDesc: Frequency, phase, and dynamic range diagnosis.
0.desc: Before processing, understanding the source material is crucial. We use spectrum analyzers, phase correlation meters, and LUFS meters to identify resonant issues, tonal imbalances, or phase problems.
0.tip: Always listen in mono initially to detect phase cancellations.

1.title: Correction
1.shortDesc: Cleaning, subtractive EQ, and noise reduction.
1.desc: The surgical stage. We remove problematic frequencies with subtractive EQ, reduce background noise, and correct vocal pitch if necessary. The goal is to clean before enhancing.
1.tip: Cut low frequencies (High Pass) on instruments that don't need them to gain clarity.

2.title: Dynamics
2.desc: We control the dynamic range for a consistent mix. We use compressors to glue elements together and soft limiters to tame unruly peaks.
2.tip: Use serial compression (multiple gentle compressors) instead of a single aggressive one for a more natural sound.

3.title: Spatial
3.desc: We create the song's 3D world. We place instruments in the stereo field (panning) and add depth with reverb and delay.
3.tip: Keep the kick, bass, and lead vocal in the center. Move rhythmic and harmonic elements to the sides.

4.title: Mastering
4.shortDesc: Loudness, final cohesion, and delivery formats.
4.desc: The final polish. We aim for competitive commercial loudness, global tonal balance, and ensure the song translates well to any playback system (car, phone, club).
4.tip: Always compare your master with reference songs of the same genre (A/B testing).

AuthModal.experiencePower: Experience the power of an advanced AI mastering engine.

MixTool.title: Upload Center
MixTool.subtitle: Drag your audio files to start. Our AI engine will automatically analyze, mix, and master your tracks.

notes.profiles: Assign each stem a profile before proceeding.
notes.buses: Fine-tune bus routing and confirm to jump to the pipeline.

messages.mixReady: Tracks prepared for mixing; press Generate Mix IA to start mixing and mastering.
messages.songReady: Song ready for mastering; press Generate AI Mastering to begin.

MixTool.songModeWarning: Song mode requires exactly one WAV/AIFF/MP3 file.
MixTool.selectionWarning: You have selected only one stem. If you want to master a song, select Song (Mastering).
MixTool.pipelineStepsDesc: Enable or disable pipeline stages for this job.

S0_SESSION_FORMAT.title: Session format & routing
S0_SESSION_FORMAT.description: Normalizes samplerate/bit depth and assigns logical buses to start clean.

S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.title: DC offset check
S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.description: Detects and fixes DC offsets on each stem.

S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.title: Working loudness
S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.description: Matches working level per stem based on its instrument profile.

S1_KEY_DETECTION.title: Key detection
S1_KEY_DETECTION.description: Estimates the song's global key and scale.

S1_VOX_TUNING.title: Vocal tuning
S1_VOX_TUNING.description: Tunes the lead vocal while respecting the detected key.

S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.title: Phase alignment (drums)
S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.description: Aligns phase/polarity across drums and percussion.

S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.title: Mixbus headroom
S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.description: Adjusts global headroom to leave space for processing.

S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.title: Lead vocal audibility
S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.description: Balances the lead vocal against the static mix.

S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.title: HPF/LPF per stem
S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.description: Applies high/low-pass filters per stem based on instrument profile.

S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.title: Resonance control
S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.description: Detects and tames narrow resonances on each stem.

S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.title: Lead vocal dynamics
S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.description: Compression and dynamics control for the lead vocal.

S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.title: Drum bus dynamics
S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.description: Drum-bus compression on drums for punch and glue.

S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.title: Bus reverb & space
S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.description: Style-aware reverb and space assignment per bus family.

S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.title: Mixbus tonal balance
S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.description: Broad EQ to match the tonal balance to the target style.

S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.title: Mixbus color
S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.description: Gentle saturation/color on the mixbus for cohesion.

S9_MASTER_GENERIC.title: Master prep
S9_MASTER_GENERIC.description: Pre-master adjustment (level and balance) before final QC.

S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.title: Master final QC
S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.description: Final check of TP/LUFS/correlation with micro-adjustments.

S11_REPORT_GENERATION.title: Report Generation
S11_REPORT_GENERATION.description: Generation of the final process report.

MixTool.stemsProfileDesc: Label each stem with its function in the mix. Later we will use these profiles to route buses.

stemsProfileSelector.title: Select instrument
stemsProfileSelector.subtitle: Choose the profile that best describes the track:

MixTool.spaceDepthDesc: Assign a reverb/space style per bus family to guide later stages.

drums.label: Drums bus
drums.description: Drum kit, programmed drums, loops, etc.

fx.label: FX / Ear candy bus
fx.description: Risers, impacts, vocal chops, creative FX.

ambience.label: Ambience / Atmos bus
ambience.description: Ambiences, atmospheres, room mics, background FX.

other.label: Other bus
other.description: Any stem not classified in the previous categories.

result.aiDesc: AI mix & mastering (result). Listen to the final mix after processing.
result.shareMixDesc: Copy the link below to share this mix with clients or friends. The link provides read-only access to listen to the result.

share.sharedMixDesc: Listen to this track mixed and mastered by Piroola AI.
share.createYourOwn: Create your own mix with Piroola

Studio.title: Piroola Studio
Studio.selectTrack: Select a track to view waveform

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our AI mixing and mastering service.

0.question: What is Piroola?
0.answer: Piroola is an advanced online service that uses Artificial Intelligence to mix and master your multi-track audio files. It analyzes your stems and applies professional studio techniques to deliver radio-ready quality tracks in minutes.

1.question: How does the AI mixing work?
1.answer: Our AI pipeline analyzes each stem for frequency content, dynamics, and tonal balance. It then applies corrective processing (EQ, compression), balances levels, places instruments in the stereo field, and adds effects like reverb to create a cohesive mix, tailored to your genre.

2.question: What file formats are supported?
2.answer: We support most standard audio formats including WAV, AIFF, FLAC, and MP3. For the best results, we recommend uploading high-quality uncompressed WAV or AIFF files (24-bit / 44.1kHz or higher).

3.question: Is my music secure?
3.answer: Yes, your security is our priority. Your files are processed securely on our servers and are automatically deleted after a short period. We do not claim any rights to your music; you retain 100% ownership of your work.

4.question: How long does the process take?
4.answer: Most mixes are completed within a few minutes, depending on the number of stems and the length of the track. You will see a progress bar indicating each step of the analysis and mixing process.

5.question: Can I upload stems?
5.answer: Absolutely. In fact, our service is designed for stems! You can upload individual instrument tracks (like kick, snare, bass, vocals) to allow our AI to mix them together perfectly.

6.question: What is the difference between mixing and mastering?
6.answer: Mixing involves balancing individual tracks (stems) to form a song, including adjusting levels, panning, and adding effects. Mastering is the final step that polishes the mixed song, ensuring it sounds consistent and loud enough for commercial release.

7.question: Do I own the rights to the mixed track?
7.answer: Yes! You maintain full copyright and ownership of your original music and the final mix produced by Piroola. You can release your tracks on any streaming platform without paying us royalties.

8.question: What if I'm not satisfied with the result?
8.answer: We provide a detailed report of the processing applied. If the result isn't what you expected, you can try adjusting the input stems (e.g., cleaning up noise) or ensuring your files are correctly labeled, and run the process again.

9.question: Is there a file size limit?
9.answer: Currently, we support reasonable file sizes typical for music production stems. If you encounter issues with extremely large projects, consider exporting your stems at a standard sample rate (e.g., 44.1kHz or 48kHz).

10.question: How do I download my results?
10.answer: Once the processing is complete, a 'Download' button will appear. You can download the final mixed and mastered stereo file directly to your device.

11.question: Can I use Piroola on mobile?
11.answer: Yes, our website is fully responsive and works on mobile devices. However, for managing multiple stem files, a desktop computer might offer a smoother workflow.

pop.title: Modern Pop Vocal
pop.summary: Bright, upfront vocals with de-essing, airy reverb, and tight low-end control for chart-ready polish.

hiphop.title: Punchy Hip-Hop
hiphop.summary: Low-end glued with parallel compression while keeping 808s clean and transients snappy on the snare.

indie.title: Indie Band
indie.summary: Phase-aligned drums, guitars separated with mid/side EQ, and a cohesive master with analog-style color.

ambient.title: Cinematic Ambient
ambient.summary: Wide, enveloping space with controlled low-mid build-up, keeping pads lush without mud.

Docs.title: Documentation & Guide
Docs.description: Comprehensive guide to using Piroola, including detailed explanations of the mixing and mastering pipeline, stages, and results.

intro.title: Piroola Documentation
intro.p1: Welcome to the official guide for Piroola. This platform leverages advanced AI to provide professional mixing and mastering services directly in your browser. Whether you are a musician, producer, or audio engineer, Piroola streamlines the complex process of audio engineering into a few simple steps.
intro.p2: Our pipeline analyzes your audio stems, corrects technical issues, balances levels, applies creative processing, and delivers a release-ready master. This guide covers everything from uploading your first track to understanding the detailed engineering report.

step1.title: 1. Uploading Stems
step1.desc: Start by dragging and dropping your audio files into the upload zone on the home page. We accept common audio formats like WAV, AIFF, and MP3. For best results, use high-quality WAV files (24-bit, 44.1kHz or higher).

step2.title: 2. Configuring Stem Profiles
step2.desc: Once uploaded, the system will attempt to automatically identify the instrument in each stem (e.g., 'Kick', 'Bass', 'Vocals'). Review the Stem Profiles panel on the right. Correct any misidentified stems to ensure the AI applies the correct processing profile.

step3.title: 3. Selecting Pipeline Stages
step3.desc: The Pipeline Steps panel allows you to enable or disable specific parts of the processing chain. By default, all stages are enabled for a complete mix and master. You can customize this if you only need specific corrections (e.g., only 'Technical Prep' or 'Mastering').

step4.title: 4. Space & Depth Settings
step4.desc: Use the Space & Depth panel on the left to define the reverb style for different instrument groups (e.g., 'Room' for Drums, 'Plate' for Vocals). If left on 'Auto', the AI will choose appropriate spaces based on the genre and instrumentation.

step5.title: 5. Generate Mix
step5.desc: Click the Generate AI Mix button. The system will queue your job and process it through the selected stages. You can monitor progress in real-time.

smartAnalysis.title: Smart Analysis
smartAnalysis.desc: Detects key, tempo, instrument types, and technical flaws like DC offset or phase issues automatically.

autoMixing.title: Auto-Mixing
autoMixing.desc: Balances levels, applies EQ, compression, and spatial effects to create a cohesive mix.

aiMastering.title: AI Mastering
aiMastering.desc: Delivers a loud, competitive master that meets commercial loudness standards (LUFS) and True Peak limits.

detailedReports.title: Detailed Reports
detailedReports.desc: Provides a comprehensive engineering report detailing every decision made by the AI, from EQ curves to compressor settings.

pipeline.title: Pipeline Stages (Deep Dive)
pipeline.desc: The Piroola pipeline consists of 12 sequential stages (S0-S11). Each stage addresses a specific aspect of audio engineering.

s0.title: S0: Input & Metadata
s0.desc: This stage handles the ingestion of your audio files. It normalizes the sample rate (48kHz) and bit depth (32-bit float) to ensure high-fidelity processing throughout the pipeline. It also validates metadata and sets up the internal routing for the session.

points.0: S0_SEPARATE_STEMS: Ensures files are treated as individual stems.
points.1: S0_SESSION_FORMAT: Converts all audio to the project standard.

s1.title: S1: Technical Preparation
s1.desc: Before mixing begins, technical issues must be resolved. This stage detects global properties like Key and Scale, and fixes individual stem issues.

points.0: DC Offset Removal: Removes inaudible low-frequency energy that eats up headroom.
points.1: Key Detection: Analyzes the song's musical key.
points.2: Vocal Tuning: Gently pitch-corrects vocals to the detected key if needed (can be disabled).
points.3: Gain Staging: Sets a healthy working loudness for each stem.

s2.title: S2: Phase & Polarity Alignment
s2.desc: Phase issues, especially in multi-mic recordings like drums, can cause tracks to sound thin or hollow. This stage analyzes the correlation between related tracks (e.g., Kick In, Kick Out, Overheads) and applies time alignment or polarity flips to ensure they sum constructively.

s3.title: S3: Static Mix & Routing
s3.desc: Establishes the initial volume balance. It ensures the lead vocal is audible and sits correctly against the backing tracks. It also sets the global mixbus headroom (typically -6dB to -12dB peak) to provide space for subsequent processing stages.

s4.title: S4: Spectral Cleanup
s4.desc: This stage cleans up the frequency spectrum of each stem.

points.0: HPF/LPF: Applies High-Pass and Low-Pass filters based on the instrument type (e.g., removing sub-bass rumble from a Hi-Hat).
points.1: Resonance Control: Identifies and cuts harsh, ringing resonant frequencies that can cause ear fatigue.

s5.title: S5: Dynamics & Level Automation
s5.desc: Applies compression and gating to control the dynamic range. It ensures quiet parts are audible and loud transients are controlled.

points.1: Vocal Dynamics: Specialized processing for vocals to keep them upfront and steady.
points.2: Bus Compression: Glue compression for groups like Drums.

s6.title: S6: Space & Depth
s6.desc: Creates a sense of space using reverb and delay. Different 'styles' (e.g., Hall, Plate, Room) are applied to different bus groups to create depth without washing out the mix. You can customize these styles in the 'Space & Depth' panel.

s7.title: S7: Multiband EQ / Tonal Balance
s7.desc: Analyzes the overall frequency spectrum of the mixbus and compares it to a target curve typical of professional releases. It applies broad, musical EQ moves to correct imbalances (e.g., too muddy, too bright).

s8.title: S8: Mix Bus Color
s8.desc: Adds subtle harmonic saturation to the entire mix. This 'glues' the elements together and adds analog-style warmth and character.

s9.title: S9: Mastering
s9.desc: The final creative stage. It brings the track up to commercial volume using limiting and maximizing. It also adjusts the stereo width to ensure an immersive experience that is still mono-compatible.

s10.title: S10: Master Stereo QC
s10.desc: A final Quality Control pass. It verifies that the master meets technical standards for True Peak (preventing digital clipping), LUFS (loudness), and channel balance. It makes micro-adjustments if any limits are exceeded.

s11.title: S11: Reporting
s11.desc: Collects data from all previous stages to generate the final JSON report and render the visual feedback provided to the user.

results.title: Understanding Results
results.p1: When processing is complete, you will be presented with the Mix Result Panel.

audioFiles.title: The Audio Files
audioFiles.desc: You can download the final Mastered Audio (WAV). This is the production-ready file. You may also have access to the unmastered Mixbus file if needed for external mastering.

report.title: The Engineering Report
report.desc: Click 'View Report' to open the detailed modal. This report contains:

points.0: Stage Summaries: Pass/Fail status for each processing step.
points.1: Detailed Metrics: Numeric data showing exactly what changed (e.g., 'Gain reduced by 2.5dB', 'EQ cut at 300Hz').
points.2: Before/After Comparisons: (Where available) Visual representations of the audio signal before and after processing.

q1.q: My mix sounds distorted. What happened?
q1.a: Check your input files. If the stems are already clipped (distorted) before upload, the AI cannot fix them. Also, ensure you haven't assigned a 'Drum' profile to a vocal track, as this can cause aggressive compression.

q2.q: The process failed at Stage S1.
q2.a: This usually means the input files were corrupted or in an unsupported format. Try re-exporting your stems as standard WAV files.

q3.q: Can I use the mastered file for streaming?
q3.a: Yes! Our S9 and S10 stages are calibrated to standard streaming loudness targets (approx -14 LUFS integrated, -1dB True Peak).

Terms.title: Terms of Service
Terms.intro: By accessing or using Piroola, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services.

0.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
0.content: By accessing or using Piroola, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services.

1.title: 2. Service Description
1.content: Piroola provides AI-assisted audio mixing and mastering services. We allow users to upload audio files, process them through our automated pipeline, and download the results.

2.title: 3. User Responsibilities
2.content: You are responsible for your use of the service and for any content you provide, including compliance with applicable laws. You must not upload any content that:

list.0: Violates any third-party intellectual property rights.
list.1: Is illegal, harmful, threatening, or otherwise objectionable.
list.2: Contains viruses or other malicious code.

3.title: 4. Intellectual Property
3.content: You retain all rights and ownership of your original content. By uploading content, you grant us a limited license to process, store, and modify your content solely for the purpose of providing the service to you. The processed output is owned by you.

4.title: 5. Limitation of Liability
4.content: Piroola is provided 'as is' without any warranties. We shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential or punitive damages, including without limitation, loss of profits, data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses.

5.title: 6. Changes to Terms
5.content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. We will provide notice of any significant changes by posting the new terms on this page. Your continued use of the service after any such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new terms.

6.title: 7. Contact Us
6.content:
If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us at:
legal@audioalchemy.com

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: Welcome to Piroola. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data.

0.title: 1. Introduction
0.content: Welcome to Piroola. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy will inform you as to how we look after your personal data when you visit our website and tell you about your privacy rights and how the law protects you.

1.title: 2. Data Controller
1.content: Piroola is the controller and responsible for your personal data. If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please contact us.

2.title: 3. The Data We Collect
2.content: We may collect, use, store and transfer different kinds of personal data about you which we have grouped together follows:

list.0: Identity Data: includes first name, last name, username or similar identifier (if applicable).
list.2: Technical Data: includes internet protocol (IP) address, your login data, browser type and version, time zone setting and location, browser plug-in types and versions, operating system and platform and other technology on the devices you use to access this website.
list.3: Usage Data: includes information about how you use our website, products and services.
list.4: Content Data: includes the audio files you upload for processing. These are processed solely for the purpose of providing the service and are not used for other purposes without your consent.

3.title: 4. How We Use Your Personal Data
3.content: We will only use your personal data when the law allows us to. Most commonly, we will use your personal data in the following circumstances:

list.0: Where we need to perform the contract we are about to enter into or have entered into with you (e.g., processing your mix).
list.1: Where it is necessary for our legitimate interests (or those of a third party) and your interests and fundamental rights do not override those interests.
list.2: Where we need to comply with a legal or regulatory obligation.

4.title: 5. Data Retention
4.content: We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes we collected it for, including for the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements. Audio files uploaded are retained only for the duration of the processing job and a reasonable period thereafter to allow you to download results, after which they are deleted.

5.title: 6. Data Security
5.content: We have put in place appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used or accessed in an unauthorized way, altered or disclosed. In addition, we limit access to your personal data to those employees, agents, contractors and other third parties who have a business need to know.

6.title: 7. Your Legal Rights
6.content: Under certain circumstances, you have rights under data protection laws in relation to your personal data, including the right to:

list.0: Request access to your personal data.
list.1: Request correction of your personal data.
list.2: Request erasure of your personal data.
list.3: Object to processing of your personal data.
list.4: Request restriction of processing your personal data.
list.5: Request transfer of your personal data.

6.footer: If you wish to exercise any of the rights set out above, please contact us.

7.title: 8. Cookies
7.content: We use cookies to distinguish you from other users of our website. This helps us to provide you with a good experience when you browse our website and also allows us to improve our site. We use Google Analytics to analyze the use of our website.

8.title: 9. Contact Details
8.content:
If you have any questions about this privacy policy or our privacy practices, please contact us at:
privacy@audioalchemy.com

0.title: 1. What Are Cookies
0.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you browse websites. They are widely used to make websites work, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the owners of the site.

1.title: 2. How We Use Cookies
1.content: We use cookies for a variety of reasons detailed below. Unfortunately, in most cases there are no industry standard options for disabling cookies without completely disabling the functionality and features they add to this site. It is recommended that you leave on all cookies if you are not sure whether you need them or not in case they are used to provide a service that you use.

list.0: Essential Cookies: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.
list.1: Functionality Cookies: These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.
list.2: Analytics Cookies: We use Google Analytics to understand how our visitors interact with the website. This helps us improve the user experience. These cookies track things such as how long you spend on the site and the pages that you visit.

3.title: 4. Third Party Cookies
3.content: In some special cases we also use cookies provided by trusted third parties. The following section details which third party cookies you might encounter through this site.
3.p2: This site uses Google Analytics which is one of the most widespread and trusted analytics solutions on the web for helping us to understand how you use the site and ways that we can improve your experience. These cookies may track things such as how long you spend on the site and the pages that you visit so we can continue to produce engaging content.

4.title: 5. Managing Cookies
4.content: You can prevent the setting of cookies by adjusting the settings on your browser (see your browser Help for how to do this). Be aware that disabling cookies will affect the functionality of this and many other websites that you visit. Disabling cookies will usually result in also disabling certain functionality and features of this site. Therefore it is recommended that you do not disable cookies.

5.title: 6. Contact Details
5.content:
If you have any questions about this cookie policy, please contact us at:
privacy@audioalchemy.com

UploadDropzone.stemsModeDesc: Upload individual tracks for a full AI mix.
UploadDropzone.dragDropSong: Drag & drop your song here, or click to select a file
UploadDropzone.dragDropStems: Drag & drop stems here, or click to select files

inputMetadata.title: Input & Metadata
inputMetadata.body: We prepare your session by organizing all uploaded files and normalizing formats, sample rates and basic metadata so the rest of the pipeline can work consistently.

technicalPreparation.title: Technical Preparation
technicalPreparation.body: We fix basic technical issues on each stem: DC offset, working loudness and initial headroom to ensure a clean, reliable starting point for mixing.

phasePolarityAlignment.title: Phase & Polarity Alignment
phasePolarityAlignment.body: We analyze multi-mic groups (like drums) to align phase and correct polarity, avoiding cancellations and restoring impact and low-end clarity.

staticMixRouting.title: Static Mix & Routing
staticMixRouting.body: We build a static balance and bus routing, placing faders and pan positions so that all elements are heard clearly before any heavy processing.

spectralCleanup.title: Spectral Cleanup
spectralCleanup.body: We clean each stem using high-pass filters and gentle notch filters to remove rumble and harsh resonances, freeing up space in the mix.

dynamicsLevelAutomation.title: Dynamics & Level Automation
dynamicsLevelAutomation.body: We control dynamics using compression, limiting and level automation, keeping performances expressive but preventing peaks from jumping out of the mix.

spaceDepthByBuses.title: Space & Depth by Buses
spaceDepthByBuses.body: We send instruments to dedicated reverb and ambience buses, placing them closer or farther in the soundstage to create a sense of depth and space.

multibandEqTonalBalance.title: Multiband EQ & Tonal Balance
multibandEqTonalBalance.body: We fine-tune the overall spectral balance so the mix feels natural and translates well across different playback systems.

mixBusColor.title: Mix Bus Color
mixBusColor.body: We add gentle saturation and bus processing to glue the mix together, enhancing warmth, punch and perceived loudness without destroying dynamics.

mastering.title: Mastering
mastering.body: We bring the track up to its target loudness, adjust final EQ, stereo width and limiting so it is ready for release on streaming platforms.

masterStereoQc.title: Master Stereo QC
masterStereoQc.body: We run final quality checks (true peak, loudness, stereo image and balance) to ensure the master meets the technical targets.

reporting.title: Reporting
reporting.body: We generate a technical report and export the final master so you can review what was done at each stage of the pipeline.

MixPipelinePanel.title: Pipeline
MixPipelinePanel.description: Explore how the mix evolves at each phase by listening to the cumulative result after every major processing block.

Report.title: Mastering Report
Report.noChangesDetected: No significant changes were applied in this stage.

S0_SESSION_FORMAT.title: Input & Metadata
S0_SESSION_FORMAT.description: Session started with <green>{count}</green> stems imported. Format verification and sample rate unification to <green>{sample_rate}</green>Hz have been performed to ensure maximum fidelity throughout the processing pipeline.

S0_SEPARATE_STEMS.title: Stem Separation
S0_SEPARATE_STEMS.description: Processed uploaded files to prepare individual stems for mixing.

S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.title: DC Offset Correction
S1_STEM_DC_OFFSET.description: Deep technical analysis performed to detect inaudible DC offset noise. Corrected to ensure maximum headroom and prevent phase issues.

S1_KEY_DETECTION.title: Key Detection
S1_KEY_DETECTION.description: Harmonic analysis engine determined the global key is <green>{key}</green> with <green>{confidence}</green>% confidence. This informs melodic tuning and frequency resonance decisions.

S1_VOX_TUNING.title: Vocal Tuning
S1_VOX_TUNING.description: Transparent pitch correction applied to vocals to match the detected key of <green>{key}</green>, maintaining natural performance while ensuring perfect tuning.

S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.title: Working Loudness
S1_STEM_WORKING_LOUDNESS.description: Working loudness normalized for each stem, ensuring all faders start at a balanced point for predictable compressor behavior.

S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.title: Drum Phase Alignment
S2_GROUP_PHASE_DRUMS.description: Phase coherence analyzed across drum microphones. Time alignment and polarity correction applied to recover lost low-end energy and impact.

S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.title: Mixbus Headroom Check
S3_MIXBUS_HEADROOM.description: Mixbus headroom re-verified to <green>{headroom_db}</green>dB to ensure summing integrity before critical mixing.

S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.title: Lead Vocal Balance
S3_LEADVOX_AUDIBILITY.description: Lead vocal level balanced by <green>{gain_db}</green>dB to sit correctly against the instrumental backing, ensuring intelligibility.

S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.title: Spectral Cleanup
S4_STEM_HPF_LPF.description: Surgical High-Pass and Low-Pass filters applied to clean the frequency spectrum, removing subsonic rumble and ultrasonic hiss.

S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.title: Resonance Control
S4_STEM_RESONANCE_CONTROL.description: Harsh frequency resonances suppressed, reducing peaks by up to <green>{max_reduction_db}</green>dB for a smoother, less fatiguing sound.

S5_STEM_DYNAMICS_GENERIC.title: Stem Dynamics
S5_STEM_DYNAMICS_GENERIC.description: Individual dynamic control applied to stems. Average gain reduction of <green>{avg_gr_db}</green>dB achieved for consistent levels without killing micro-dynamics.

S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.title: Vocal Dynamics
S5_LEADVOX_DYNAMICS.description: Lead vocal processed with dedicated compression, applying <green>{gr_db}</green>dB reduction to keep the vocal firm and upfront.

S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.title: Drum Bus Compression
S5_BUS_DYNAMICS_DRUMS.description: Glue compression applied to the drum bus with <green>{gr_db}</green>dB reduction, unifying the kit into a cohesive, punchy instrument.

S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.title: Spatial Depth
S6_BUS_REVERB_STYLE.description: Spatial dimension added using '<green>{style}</green>' reverb style, placing instruments in their own acoustic space for depth.

S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.title: Tonal Balance
S7_MIXBUS_TONAL_BALANCE.description: Global frequency spectrum analyzed and corrected by up to <green>{max_correction_db}</green>dB. Tonal balance sculpted to match genre standards, ensuring clear bass, mids, and highs.

S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.title: Mixbus Saturation
S8_MIXBUS_COLOR_GENERIC.description: Analog character injected via soft saturation (<green>{drive_percent}</green>%) acting as sonic glue. This increased density (RMS <green>{diff_inputLoudness}</green>dB) and raised the noise floor by <green>{diff_noiseFloor}</green>dB for rich texture.

S9_MASTER_GENERIC.title: Mastering Limiter
S9_MASTER_GENERIC.description: Loudness maximized for commercial competition with a <green>{ceiling_db}</green>dB safety ceiling. Dynamics controlled for a large, present sound while preserving transient punch.

S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.title: Final QC
S10_MASTER_FINAL_LIMITS.description: Final Quality Control passed. Integrated loudness of <green>{lufs}</green> LUFS and True Peak of <green>{true_peak}</green> dBTP achieved, ensuring distortion-free streaming playback.

S13_MANUAL_CORRECTION.title: Manual Correction
S13_MANUAL_CORRECTION.description: Manual adjustments applied based on user feedback in Piroola Studio.
